title: Logistics-Based Manager Job at Wendernek Consulting Limited
content:
Wendernek Consulting Limited is a leading human resource outsourcing management solutions provider in Nigeria. Our purpose is to provide applied and bespoke solutions to our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics-Based Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Logistics Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, and executing the movement, tracking, and documentation of equipment, materials, and personnel in support of our operations in the upstream, mid, and downstream oil and gas.
	The role ensures timely mobilization/demobilization of tools, compliance with regulatory requirements, and the coordination of land, sea, and air transport.
	This position plays a crucial part in minimizing non-productive time (NPT) and ensuring smooth operational continuity by aligning supply chain and field service requirements with logistics execution.


Key Responsibilities
Material and Equipment movement:


	Coordinate inbound and outbound shipments of oilfield tools, spare parts, consumables, and heavy equipment.
	Schedule and monitor deliveries via road, sea freight, and air freight, ensuring alignment with project timelines.
	Liaise with freight forwarders, haulers, rig/base personnel, and service companies for logistics planning.


Loadout and Backload Operations:


	Prepare loadout lists, packing lists, and cargo manifests for rig mobilization or job site support.
	Supervise backload returns, including inspection, documentation, and quarantine (if applicable).
	Ensure load compliance with lifting plans, weight limits, and HSE requirements.


Inventory and Material tracking:


	Track real-time location and status of tools and equipment through ERP or logistics software.
	Support inventory control teams with stock movements, bin transfers, and usage reporting.
	Maintain traceability of serialized equipment and rental assets.


Documentation and Customs Compliance:


	Generate shipping documentation: delivery notes, waybills, material transfer notes, manifests, and commercial invoices.
	Coordinate with customs brokers for import/export clearance in line with local regulations.
	Ensure adherence to documentation standards for bonded, non-bonded, and client-owned materials.


Vendor and Transport Coordination:


	Arrange trucking, vessel booking, and air cargo as per job urgency, tool availability, and route planning.
	Verify vendor compliance with HSE, transport, and documentation requirements.
	Coordinate return of rental tools and vendor-supplied equipment post-job.


HSE and Regulatory Compliance:


	Enforce load securing, safe lifting, and hazardous goods handling procedures.
	Ensure that logistics processes meet local, international, and company HSE standards.
	Participate in safety briefings, toolbox talks, and risk assessments related to transport or loading


Base/Yard Support:


	Coordinate with base teams for cargo preparation, staging, and dispatch.
	Ensure physical inspection of goods before shipment to confirm readiness and condition.
	Monitor yard layout efficiency for ease of loading/unloading and HSE adherence.


Communication and Stakeholder Liasion:


	Maintain constant communication with field service teams, workshop supervisors, and clients.
	Provide regular updates to operations and project managers on shipment status and ETAs.
	Act as a single point of contact for urgent dispatches, job mobilizations, and material logistics support.


Emergency and After-Hours Support:


	Be available for urgent call-outs, especially during operational downtime or high-priority jobs.
	Arrange express dispatches and last-minute freight bookings under pressure.


Requirements


	Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	4–8 years of experience in logistics coordination, preferably in the oil and gas.
	IATA/IMDG Certification for Dangerous Goods Handling
	Logistics/Supply Chain Certification (e.g., CILT, APICS, CSCMP)
	Forklift, Crane, or Lifting Certification (as applicable)
	HSE Certifications (e.g., OSHA, NEBOSH awareness)
	Strong understanding of oilfield tools, consumables, and supply chain cycles.
	Experience working with freight forwarders, customs agents, and bonded shipments.


Key Competencies:
Technical:


	Proficient in ERP/logistics software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Tallyman, Maximo)
	Knowledge of Incoterms, freight booking, and trade documentation
	Familiar with warehouse systems, asset tracking, and stock movement procedures
	Ability to interpret load charts, rig-up requirements, and lifting plans


Working Conditions:


	Logistics yard or base environment with field exposure.
	May involve shift work, extended hours, or weekend availability.
	Requires PPE and compliance with safety regulations in warehouse/yard areas.
	May include travel to port, customs office, or operational sites as needed.


Salary
N500,000 (Five Hundred Thousand Naira p/m)

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should their Resume / CV to: recruitment@wendernek.com using the Job Position as the subject of email.

title: Finance Manager Job at Rolad Properties
content:
At Rolad Properties, we are on a global mission to build premium homes and unlock dreams through land schemes, property acquisition, and co-funding opportunities. As the Finance Manager, you will play a vital role in shaping the financial future of our fast-growing real estate firm by identifying strategic investment opportunities, evaluating the financial viability of projects, and driving funding initiatives. Your expertise will guide the business in making informed investment decisions and securing the capital needed to bring high-impact developments to life.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Manager
Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Finance Department
Reports To: Executive Director & Managing Director
Work Mode: Hybrid (The first month of resumption is on-site)

Job Overview


	The Finance Manager will oversee the financial well-being and strategy of our real estate firm.
	This ideal candidate is highly skilled and strategic and plays a crucial role in driving financial efficiency, ensuring sustainable growth, and supporting investment decisions within the organization.
	The finance manager would be responsible for collaborating with key stakeholders to align financial management with the company’s long-term vision


Job Description
Key Responsibilities:
Financial Strategy & Leadership:


	Create and implement financial strategies that align with the organization's business goals.
	Identify and mitigate financial risk while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
	Champion financial planning, forecasting, and budgeting process to ensure a comprehensive financial performance.


Investment Management:


	Conduct financial due diligence for property acquisitions and developments.
	Evaluate potential real estate investments and projects to maximize returns.
	Manage and sustain relationships with investors, banks, and other financial institutions to secure favorable funding terms.


Operational Excellence & Efficiency:


	Oversees the day-to-day operations of the department, including accounts, payroll, receivables/payables, and cash flow management.
	Collaborate with other departments to align financial objectives with operational strategies.
	Develop key metrics and KPIs to track organizational performance


Compliance & Governance:


	Ensure adherence to financial laws, tax regulations, and industry standards.
	Introduce and implement corporate governance best practices to protect company assets and boost investor confidence


Team Leadership:


	Provide learning and development opportunities to ensure the team stays abreast with current trends.
	Create a culture of innovation and collaboration within the department.
	Supervise and support the finance team, ensuring efficient operations and providing guidance to enhance their performance


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field (Master's or advanced degree is an advantage).
	5+ years of progressive experience in financial management
	Professional certifications, such as ACCA, is preferred
	Strong analytical skills and ability to leverage data for decision-making.
	Expertise in financial planning, investment management, and analysis.
	Exceptional leadership, communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills.
	Proficiency in advanced Microsoft Excel and financial software.


Salary
N800,000 - N1,000,000 Monthly.
